ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Question for Rokenn
ygData.msgSnippet: We ve had a ranger pull the bladestorms the past few nights now.  They can hit them with a Raincaller and 150 ranger arrows.  We ve also had the blades come by
ygData.messageBody:
We've had a ranger pull the bladestorms the past few nights now. They can
hit them with a Raincaller and 150 ranger arrows. We've also had the blades
come by aggroing a mob too close Dojorn's island.
We haven't however been able to get Dojorn to leave his island. Probably
some nerf by Verant so that people don't pull him. Of course we could just
go down to island one and take the portal back up to his island, but this
costs a lot of time and money, especially if we want to go back to gorgalosk
island afterwards. Would Verant nerf Dojorn so that he can only be killed
by spending a lot of money? Prolly. Him not leaving his island certainly
doesn't accomplish anything else. Doesn't make him harder to kill, just
more time consuming and expensive. Verant loves money-sinks and lots of
downtime.

What interested me was Rokenn mentioning some trick that a paladin had for
making the Blades leave Dojorn's island. Just wondering if this is
something that can be done from Dojorn's island, or if it also requires
going up to Gorgalosk island first. If we only need to go to Dojorn's, we
could go up any night of the week and kill him at relatively little cost in
platinum.


Elwyn

-----Original Message-----
From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2000 11:25 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Question for Rokenn


From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>

We got bladestorm(s?) by pulling I-3 mobs too close to their social (agro)
range. We'd pull something and get the something and a bladestorm. Sorry
that's kinda vague but I did not see what exactly they were doing and the
discussion was about pulling too close to the edge of that side of the
island.

Sylly
